page.title: 06Sally Busby's Riding Stables
page.content: Riding is a very popular sport, but it is not only a leisure time activity. Walking is the only alternative to riding if you want to see what is happening in the countryside and walking is so slow. The best way to explore the forest is on a horse along the Bridle paths. We had a good look at her 15 horses and ponies. Sally was in the training ring when we arrived, so we watched some cantering and trotting. She uses 4 fields and the ring but she also takes people out on rides. She helps about 35 children and 50 adults each week. In the stables the horses had comfortable beds, which took up most of the room. The bed was made of sawdust. It costs Â£5 a week in summer and up to Â£20 in winter to feed a pony.
